body.value: About seven years ago, our lives intersected for about two years at the University of Iowa w, where Christopher w, along with two or three other poets suddenly arrived, in that middle state w in the United States w, with not just English accents, but a whole body of literatures and languages behind them. Christopher was not just in the poetry workshop, but was doing a lot of translations from German and Dutch, writing his own poetry, was a kind of formidable character with these obscure languages, at least obscure to me at the time. He has since come on, after doing his Ph.D. at Carleton w where he is an Assistant Professor of English. His third book of poems, Stills, is being published in the next few weeks by Chatto and Windus w, and should be looked for at your bookstores. He's asked for it to come but it hasn't arrived yet. So without any further delay, Christopher Levenson.
